partName: Fox Body / SN95 / New Edge Mustang Suspension
notes: The chassis is largely the same. SN95 front control arms are longer (wider track) and 5-lug, a common upgrade for Fox Bodies. SN95 spindles allow for better brake options (Cobra brakes). Rear control arms interchange but lengths vary slightly.

The 'GT40' and 'GT40P' intake manifolds found on V8 Explorers flow significantly better than the stock Mustang HO intake. It's the cheapest horsepower upgrade for a Fox Body. Requires the matching throttle body and EGR setup.

The Lincoln Mark VIII uses the same 4.6L DOHC V8 as the Cobra. The 93-98 blocks are cast by Teksid in Italy and are the strongest aluminum modular blocks Ford ever made, capable of 1000+ hp. A cheap junkyard find for high-power builds.

compatibleVehicles: Ford Mustang Fox Body / SN95 (Solid Axle)
notes: The IRS from the 99-04 Cobra bolts into any 79-04 Mustang chassis (the mounting holes are already there in the frame rails!). Provides better handling and ride quality but is heavier than the solid axle. Popular for track cars.

The entire front suspension crossmember from a 2003+ Crown Vic (aluminum, rack and pinion, disc brakes) bolts into older Ford F-series trucks with relatively minor fabrication. It lowers the truck and provides modern handling.
